page.title: 03Local events Dalgety Bay.
page.content: Many interesting events take place in Dalgety Bay throughout the year. The main organising body is the Sailing Club which organises raft races across the bay, barbeques on the foreshore during summer evenings, discos throughout the year and a bonfire and firework display on November 5th. On occasions the club organises special excursions to Inchcolm, an island in the Firth of Forth formerly inhabited by monks who lived in the 12th century Abbey of Inchcolm. All that remains there now are ruins and an abundance of bird life. Many events organised by the club are also open to non members. During August the Dalgety Bay Gala takes place during which the Gala Queen, a primary seven pupil chosen from either of the two local primary schools, is crowned.
